import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

import StatusCodes from "@theme/StatusCodes";
import OperationTabs from "@theme/OperationTabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Request a MFA token via text message"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/mfa/sms"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Request a MFA token via text message.

#### Permissions
The API token must include one of the following scopes: _Voice_ or _Messaging_ or _Fax_.


<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={undefined}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"required":true,"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"allOf":[{"allOf":[{"type":"object","properties":{"to":{"type":"string","description":"The E164 number to use as the destination.","example":"+14043287382"}},"required":["to"]},{"type":"object","properties":{"from":{"type":"string","description":"The E164 number from your account to use as the origin of the message. SignalWire will use a special verified number if not specified. If using a different caller ID, make sure it is a number you have purchased or have verified on your SignalWire account and ensure it is registered on the Campaign Registry for the best deliverability.\n","example":"+12029167968"},"message":{"type":"string","description":"Specify a custom message to send before the token. The message must fit within one segment; either 160 characters or 70 characters when using non-GSM symbols. When using a custom `message`, you must use your own purchased or verified number as the `from`. Defaults to \"Your Personal Authorization Code is:\"\n","example":"Here is your code"}}},{"type":"object","properties":{"token_length":{"type":"number","description":"The number of characters in the token, from 4 to 20. Defaults to 6.","example":6},"max_attempts":{"type":"number","description":"The number of allowed verification attempts, including the first one, from 1 to 20. Defaults to 3.","example":3},"allow_alphas":{"type":"boolean","description":"Set to `true` or `false`, whether to include letters or just numbers in the token. Defaults to `false` (numbers only).","example":false},"valid_for":{"type":"number","description":"The number of seconds the token is considered valid for. Defaults to 3600, with a maximum of 604800.","example":3600}}}]}]}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

<StatusCodes
  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}
  responses={{"200":{"description":"OK","content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"id":{"type":"string","description":"The MFA request ID. Save this for verification.","format":"uuid"},"success":{"type":"boolean","description":"Whether the request was successfully queued.","example":true},"to":{"type":"string","description":"The destination of the MFA request.","example":"+15554422333"},"channel":{"type":"string","description":"Can be `sms` for a text message or `call` for a phone call.","example":"call"}}}}}}}}
>
  
</StatusCodes>
